{{Infobox WCBB Team |name = Colorado Buffaloes | logo = University-of-Colorado-Boulder-sports-logo.png |logo_size = 150px |university = University of Colorado at Boulder |conference = Big 12 Conference |conference_short = Big 12 (through June 2011)
Pac-12 (beginning July 2011) |division = North |city = Boulder |stateabb = CO |state = Colorado |coach = Linda Lappe |tenure = 1st |arena = [[Coors Events Center]] |capacity = 11,064 |nickname = Buffaloes |color1 = Gold |color2 = Silver |fontcolor = 000000 |hex1 = C5B358 |hex2 = C0C0C0 |h_body=C5B358 |h_pattern_b=_thinsidesonwhite |h_shorts=C5B358 |h_pattern_s=_blanksides2 |a_body=C5B358 |a_pattern_b=_thingreysides |a_shorts=C5B358 |a_pattern_s= |NCAAchampion = |NCAAfinalfour = |NCAAeliteeight = 1993, 1995, 2002 |NCAAsweetsixteen = 1994, 1997, 2003 |NCAAsecondround = 1995, 1988, 1996, 2001 |NCAAtourneys = 1981, 1988, 1989, 1992, 1993, 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2004 |conference_tournament = 1989, 1992, 1995, 1996, 1997 |conference_season = 1989, 1995 |WNITfinalfour = 2004 |WNITsecondround = 1999 |WNITtourneys = 1999, 2004 }} The '''[[Colorado Buffaloes]] women's [[basketball]] team''' represents the [[University of Colorado at Boulder|University of Colorado]] and competes in the [[Big 12 Conference]] of [[NCAA]] [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]]. ==Conferences== Colorado has played in the Big 8 and the Big 12 conferences. The Buffaloes joined the Big 12 in 1997 when the Big 8 merged with several former members of the defunct Southwest Conference. ==Coaches== Colorado's head women's basketball coach is Linda Lappe, who is entering her first season at Colorado. Lappe hired assistant coaches Jennie Baranczyk, Johnna Pointer, and Jonas Chatterton.CU Women's Basketball - 2010-11 Coaching Staff
